evidence.title: README (segment 1)
README (segment 2)
evidence.excerpt: **`wuchale`** (pronounced "wuh-cha-lay") is a compile-time internationalization toolkit that requires no code changes. Write your components naturally, and `wuchale` automatically extracts and replaces translatable messages at build time.

evidence.title: README (segment 3)
evidence.excerpt: - **üßº No extra syntax!** - Your normal code is enough, your codebase stays clean - **üì¶ Tiny catalogs to bundle** - Text catalogs are just arrays, no keys necessary, like Protobuf - **üîå Zero-effort integration** - Add i18n to existing projects without rewriting code - **üß© Framework agnostic** - Works with React, Preact, Svelte(Kit), SolidJS, Astro, and plain JS/TS - **‚ú® Optional AI translation** - Configurable integration for automatic on-the-fly translations - **‚ö° Full, granular HMR support** - Live updates during development, including AI auto-translation - **üì¶ Tiny footprint** - Very few (less than 5) additional dependencies, no bloated `node_modules` - **üß† Smart extraction** - Uses AST analysis to handle nested markup, conditionals, loops, and complex interpolations - **üåç Standard .po files** - Compatible with existing translation tools and workflows

evidence.title: README (segment 4)
evidence.excerpt: No imports, no wrappers, no annotations. `wuchale` handles everything at compile time by analyzing your code and automatically extracting translatable strings.

evidence.title: README (segment 5)
evidence.excerpt: See the [Getting Started guide](https://wuchale.dev/intro/start/) for instructions specific to your project type.

evidence.title: README (segment 6)
evidence.excerpt: 1. **Scans your source code** using AST and identify translatable text content 2. **Extracts strings** into standard `.po` translation files for translators 3. **Compiles catalogs** into compact modules which export arrays 4. **Replaces strings** with translation function calls that access messages by indices from the arrays

evidence.title: README (segment 7)
evidence.excerpt: Your original code stays clean and readable, while the build output is automatically internationalized.

evidence.title: README (segment 8)
evidence.excerpt:
```jsx // src/components/Welcome.jsx function Welcome({ name }) { return (

Welcome to our app!

Hello, {name}! How are you today?

) } ```

evidence.title: Newly added string does not load properly until server restart
evidence.excerpt: Newly added string does not load properly until server restart (state:closed)

evidence.title: Support locale fallback chains for regional variants
evidence.excerpt: Support locale fallback chains for regional variants (state:open)
